Reviews.Title: “Pay no attention to the perfectionists”
Reviews.Author: SRains
Reviews.Content: OK - you have to keep your view of this Hotel in perspective. The building is older than the USA itself... so its not perfect in terms of being a modern hotel It is however clean and comfortable and the location simply could not be better. The staff were all EXTREMELY pleasent and helpful. Breakfast was fine - meat, cheese, juice, coffee etc We were in room 201 at the front and we loved it - we will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Stop. Go Back. Save yourselves.”
Reviews.Author: Patrick W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is shameful for the price. We have actually had a reasonably good time here from laughing at how bad the place is. The staff really are very friendly, but they know what you are about to walk into. At reception you will be informed that there are no refunds for cancellation, so that if you flee in horror your credit card will still be billed. Beginning with breakfast: It's 10pm and I am still yet to digest the stale croissant from this morning and the coffee which I think was piped in directly from the Grand Canal. With each passing day fewer and fewer people avail themselves of the breakfast offerings. Everyone eats in underwhelmed silence and whispers as though they were at a funeral. Indeed, the idea of breakfast has died here. My recommendation is to keep fasting. There is a faint but undeniable scent of old fish which has kept us mildly nauseated for days. Bathroom: Essentially needs to be gutted and re-built. There is an abundance of sellotape holding things like towel rails together. There is no shower curtain, and it is amazing how water coming at such low pressure from the broken shower head can saturate the entire bathroom. To avoid this, we tried the bath instead, but waiting for the thing to fill is an exercise in geological time. The hairdryer on the wall resembles something that an alien from a cheap sci-fi film of the 70's might use to probe someone. It does not dry hair particularly well. We did ask for the shower head to be fixed but got nothing other than a sympathetic smile and shrug of the shoulders. If you can both find and activate the tiny television you will be disappointed but not surprised to discover no cable channels. I know it's Italy but not even to have one of the english language news services is a bit cheap these days. This is somewhat alleviated by the free wifi, which is one of the plusses of this place. The other much vaunted plus is the location, and the view of the canal and rialto bridge is nice if you are lucky enough to get one of those rooms. But honestly people, the canal is long and there are many hotels along it. You CAN do better. There are chandeliers and fancy wall lights, but I would unscrew the chandelier from the ceiling and hand it in at reception in exchange for a working shower head. Come on guys. Priorities. If you want your Venice experience to be full of the tragic ambiance of former glory fallen into decay, then this is the hotel for you. Otherwise steer clear.

Reviews.Title: “Locanda Ovidius”
Reviews.Author: Ana K
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, nice setting, comfortable rooms, decent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: artibabe
Reviews.Content: From 30dec2011 - 02jan2012 @ 210â‚¬ per night = 840â‚¬. This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. How do I loathe thee. Let me count the ways. Where to start?. Bathroom: toilet lid cracked; shower leaked where head attached to hose making it impossible to keep water off floor; lid of waste bin broken. Bedroom: thermostat broken, had to be adjusted from desk; television broken, telephone to desk broken - both replaced next day, but after I wanted to view possible fireworks display New Years Eve. When the forced air heat worked, there was an odor of stale cooking that seemed to have mixed with air input which we cleared by opening window. Repeat. Confirmed by hotel management. Closet not deep enough for a normal hanger, clothes at an angle. What seemed to be a set of dresser drawers was actually a cover for a third bed, consequently no place to store clothing - used suitcases from floor. Breakfast: no fresh fruit; no fresh brioche nor eggs or any warm food; toast could be made from very plain white bread, the one time I used the toaster the bread was not fresh; coffee made from a powder; if you would want a cappuccino it would have costed one euro more. At a certain point it seemed not worth the trouble of complaining about an impossible situation. (Had a fantastic New Years concert at Fenice and a very nice New Years meal at Al Paradiso).

Reviews.Title: “Review of Locanda Ovidus B&B Venice”
Reviews.Author: Tandiwe7
Reviews.Content: Oh the Disappointment! We had understood from earlier reviews of this establishment that the Locanda really was something very special. In addition we were under the impression that we had booked a room overlooking the Grand Canal. Instead we were given the key to a dark, gloomy room overlooking the side alley and, on asking if we had made a mistake, told that, for an extra 50 Euros per night on top of the 224 Euros per night we had already paid, that could be arranged..... We declined the offer and made do. It looks as though an 'architect/designer' on drugs has been at work. One of our shower 'walls' was actually the bathroom window so how long before the window frame rots and falls into the alley below is debatable. Doorways had been boarded up and the lift smelt so bad we thought a corpse might be at the bottom of the lift shaft. Wi-Fi was, of course charged extra and breakfast consisted entirely of pre-packaged items e.g. processed cheese, coffee from a thermos flask etc 'served' by a very glum waitress who barely acknowledged anyone's presence. What really puzzled us was the 'TripAdvisor merit badge' at reception! How on earth had they been awarded this - TripAdvisor had better send someone 'ingognito' to take a look at this establishment! The hotel had two things going for it - a kind of common room with balcony overlooking the Rialto Bridge and the Grand Canal - with the weather absolutely perfect it was very agreeable to bring a cold beer from the stall just around the corner and just watch the world go by. It was, too, very convenient for getting to see all the sights. And a further gripe - beware of Hotels.com. We booked by Credit Card but when we received our C.Card statement it had an extra 66 Euros tacked on to cover an Italian Central Govt tax. This was explained to us as we checked out - not the fault of the hotel, of course, but we were then told Hotels.com charge Hotel Locanda Ovidus 25% commission. So if you really MUST use this establishment, book direct, but don't say you haven't been warned!

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: monkey057
Reviews.Content: this hotel is small but perfectly proportioned. my wife and I stayed for a week to celebrate her birthday. The location of the hotel is perfect for exploring . The staff were very attentive. and friendly. and we were treated to a bottle of champane i our room on the day of celebration.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not worth the price tag!”
Reviews.Author: beeker_xox
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very close to Rialto bridge and restaurants, but the cost to stay in a tiny gotti room was not worth it. We had booked with the hotel directly and told them we were on our honeymoon hoping that we would get a better room. This did not work. Our room smelled like fish because it was located in the alley between 2 restaurants and was very noisy! Room was not very clean and breakfast was minimal and they charged 1 euro for coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Look elswhere - PLEASE”
Reviews.Author: A-Keen-Walker
Reviews.Content: I agree with the most recent reviews posted regarding this hotel. I suppose some of the rooms must be nice, but the one we were shown to (Room 104) was dreadful. Small, sparcely furnished, overlooking the shabby side street where the entrance to the hotel is to be found. At Â£162.20 per night I would consider it to be expensive at half the price. The en-suite was laughable - small, and with a bit of manouevring I guess it would be possible to get into the shower cubicle. The owners should be ashamed at charging what they do for this. It might be appropriate for someone looking for a cheap bunk for the night but not at this price. After complaining we were shown to another room, which was accessed up a steep narrow staircase to the bathroom level, and then a narrow spiral staircase to the bedroom. The room was basic with a step across the middle which we kept tripping on until we got used to it. No table/desk upon which to put anything, but I suppose it would be difficult to get any such furniture up the staircase (I wonder how they got the bed in there!). The shower rail was loose and did not hold the shower head. A feeble shower - not sure whether this was low water pressure or a clogged up shower head - I did not feel inclined to investigate. The overall fabric of the place is poor and in need of a complete overhaul and cleaning. Wallpaper hanging off, broken chandeliers, missing light bulbs, bare plaster board walling on the main stairway, ..... The shabby unrendered outside reflects what you will find on the inside. Breakfast was cheap and uninspiring. They had the cheek to ask for a supplement if you wanted fresh coffee. Otherwise coffee was found in a flask. Cereals, yogurt, dry bread, ham/salami, prepacked soft cheeses and prepacked croissants. Just dreadful. Reception was often unattended - the "Back Soon" notice always seemed to be there. A 4 out of 5 Trip Advisor Rating Certificate is prominently displayed. Does TripAdvisor calculate this from all feedback reports or just the most recent? The latter I think would be most appropriate. Anything positive to say - location close to Rialto might be considered to be good, but quite frankly anywhere in the San Marco or San Polo areas can be considered good and easily accessible to all the important places to visit in Venice, so nothing special about this place. The weather was good. When checking in we were asked to sign a form agreeing to certain points, one being the hotel would claim the full fee for our stay even if we decided to cancel and move elsewhere. If you really want to stay here after what I have said above I would strongly recommend that you inspect the room before signing anything, and before paying the tourist tax that hotels in Venice are now obliged to collect. Would I stay here again? - not if you paid me. Have I any chance of getting my money back? - I don't suppose so.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful when you book”
Reviews.Author: janetBonbeach
Reviews.Content: The photos of this hotel and the reality are quite two different things. The location is just wonderful as it is right near the Rialto Bridge and the Grand Canal but the room we were shown was so small we could not fit our cases inside! We had many discussions before we were shown a room that was acceptable and for this reason I would not recommend you choose this hotel. There are so many others in the same area that would be better.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and very small rooms, poor breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Aboensis
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is simply great. Many places in Venetzia are easy to reach by vaporetto(nearest vaporetto stops Rialto and St Silvestro) or just by walk. There are rooms with two kinds of view (Grande Canal or narrow alley). I had a view to nearby house. The room and especially bathroom were tiny. The decoration was antique style but little shabby. Breakfast was lousy and definitely no value for money. Staff members were friedly and helpfull. Overall this hotel needs some improvement. I suppose they just rely on the good location to get their part of the endless flow of tourists. The Tripadvisor member 'mehmetic' has commented this thing before. Locanda Ovidius is not a bad base to explore magniFicent Venetzia but perhaps there are also better options.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel along the canal - great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Gung_ho_in_TO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights to cap off our trip through Italy. Hotel is in a great location - near the canal, Rialto Bridge, near several waterbus stops, restaurants, gonolas, the market (flea, fish/fruit) etc. It was a bit tough to find it at first - one reviewer suggested getting off at the Rialto stop (actually, you should get off at either the Rialto Mercato or S.Silvestro stops - ~5min walk to the hotel from either stop - this will eliminate the need to walk across the Rialto Bridge, which is a hassle with luggage, lots of steps to climb and descend and lots of tourists in the way). Another small room (although, it was the biggest room during our week trip). Bathroom had the best layout but the shower head holder was a bit broken (no biggie as it was also a handheld too). The bed was two singles pushed together though. Our room was just around the corner from where breakfast was served and where there was a great view of the canal from a small balcony - that was pretty cool. The room had a safety box, mini bar and a small hanging old style tube tv. It was air conditioned (as were all the rooms we stayed in). There was free wifi for us that worked great from our room (we booked directly with the hotel to get free wifi vs. through a discount website where there was a surcharge for wifi). If we had paid cash we would have been given a 10% discound off our rate (again, an agreement we had directly with the hotel). Breakfast was the standard again - bread, yogurt, luncheon meats, juice, cereal. The city is easily walkable so location-wise I'm sure any hotel would do but we got a waterbus pass and took it up and down the canal to get a great view of the city. Overall, the hotel was great value given the location along the canal. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: h2obury21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing special, but the view and location can't be beat. We had one of the rooms facing the Rialto Bridge and the Canal and it was perfect. At night we could either stay in our room and watch the people on the Canal or sit on the balcony right outside our room. It wasn't loud at night considering the location. The hotel was close to places to eat and shopping. The only flaw is that there is no elevator and the flight of stairs is not small. We had just come from London and Paris, so the luggage was a little heavy to get up the stairs. The price of the room is a little higher than I would expect for the condition of the room, but would still stay here again, based on the location. Unlike other European hotels, the rooms were a decent size, at least the one we were in.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Hotel Ovidius for making our 35th Anniversary so incredible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BobnRachel
Reviews.Content: We were a bit overwhelmed at our first visit to Venice and Italy, but David at reception made us feel right at home immediately. Our room with the view of the Rialto Bridge was spectacular and it was so close to everything. We were splurging to come to Italy in the first place so really appreciated the great value!!! I could not have asked for a more romantic celebration and they went out of their way to treat us special for our special occassion. I cannot thank David, Sebastian and the Hotel Ovidius enough!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good value”
Reviews.Author: addicted2travelme
Reviews.Content: Check in reception is in neighbouring hotel, Locanda Antica Sturion (bad smell in this reception). Rooms in Locanda Ovidius are on 1st floor - there is no lift, Sitting room with balcony has STUNNUNG views across the Grand Canal - beuatiful day and night. Breakfast is in Locanda Antica Sturion. - One floor above the sitting room of this hotel - there is a lift to the second floor. Breakfast room has view over Grand Canal and balcony as floor below. Rooms very hot ( we were there in February) Meats, cheese, toast (which launches out of the two toasters!), cereals and packed croissants/brioche provided a very reasonable breakfast 8:00 - 10:00 Fridge with mini bar can be used for own drinks. Beds very hard, room & en-suite a little dated but very clean. Clean sheets & towels every day, TV has no English channels & very unstable on bracket. All staff very courteous. Would recommend to all and will stay again if we return, V Good value for money. WI fi only included if you book with hotel direct. ..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,clean but basic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: windyhabour
Reviews.Content: Location next to Rialto bridge,Rooms clean.We paid extra for a superior room which was bigger.Can't really complain about anything,my 3rd stay here and happy each time.The only thing is that the breakfast could be better.The bread was stale,the juice /cordial was too sweet there was not much else to eat.Reception was friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location, Good Price,”
Reviews.Author: nrossiLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a city break three nights - location wise superb a couple of minutes walk to the Rialto bridge (stunning views from the balcony of the breakfast room). Staff helped with whatever we needed and the room was fine and made up every day by the cleaners! breakfast was simple but you make of it what you wish ! overall the hotel offered great location a very reasonable price and a really good base for our Venice vacation !

Reviews.Title: “i hiden gem of a HOTEL WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: arthurloev
Reviews.Content: A wonderful Hotel to stay at. The staff are all so hospitable. the hotel clean and a wonderful location near the Rialto Bridge. Small breakfast was included - small tho sufficient. Our room was facing the canal and windows opened out so we could look out.. The front desk personnel even put together 3 couples to share the cost of a water taxi to airport at 4:30 am.. cannot recommend enough. small room- but sufficient .. Only neghative was we had to leave to return home

Reviews.Title: “good location, good staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: georg1eb0y
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel early morning and were met by sebastian who was very friendly, helpful and informative. The first room we were offered at the back of the hotel was a bit small and the view from the window was a brick wall, so i asked if he had any thing better and we were shown a lovley room at the front of the hotel overlooking the canal by the rialto bridge. The room was next to the breakfast room so we knew when it was time to get up..! Its a continental breakfast they serve here, so basic but all you need really. Yes it is a bit noisy early morning when the boats are doing there deliveries but not that bad. To sum up i quite liked it here, there are better hotels in venice thats for sure but they will cost lots more than this one which has a good location and i thought was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, helpful staff, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Gansosalvaje
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from the staying at the Locanda Ovidius and would go back there for the following reasons: Really helpful staff: they sorted out the suitcases we had locked the key in, gave us advice on restaurants, helped us with travel and let us use the hotel before we checked in and after we checked out as we had early and later flights. Great location: it is next to the Rialto and the vaporetti stops (use theroute number 1 to the S.SILVESTRO stop as you don't need to lug suitcases over the Rialto bridge). The communal balcony is great for watching the world go by, meeting people and eating a picnic. Look out for the free trip to, but not back from, Murano which leaves every day at 09:00. The internet appears to be free for some room rates but not others, it is â‚¬5 per stay if not free. The internet terminal in one of their two(!) receptions was not working when we were there. The downside is the price which I found a bit high for a three star hotel undergoing rennovations and the breakfast, which is poor. The prepackaged croissants were the worst I have ever eaten. There was also no fruit of any kind. We did know about this beforehand but it is still disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: neverhome_10
Reviews.Content: Our room faced the Grand Canal and was right next to the breakfast room. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. They had great recommendations for food and shopping. The locations was wonderful, close to everything. It rained for a day and a half while we were there. We were happy to sit at our opened windows with a bottle of wine and watch all the happenings on the Canal. We highly recommend with hotel and their staff.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: kclarke60
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a 3 night break at this hotel i would highly reccommend it.The location is brilliant right on the grand canal with a view of the rialto bridge. I must point out that many of the rooms face the alley side of the hotel with no view to speak of but iff you venture from your room to the shared sitting area on the first floor which leads onto a lovely balcony with whicker chairs and tables whereby u can relax and watch the all the comings and goings on the canal absoloutley fantastic esp iff you purchase your wine from the little delis in the back streets for approx 5-6 euros and not the extragavant prices charged in the resteraunts. Food tastier in the more smaller resteraunts and cheaper too average meal approx 60-70 euros on the canal so beware but nice for the view. godolas approx 80 euros for half an hour but i think well worth the money.Bascillica a must but be prepared to que better to get there well before it opens at 9.45am. Doges palace amazing but me and hubby bitten to hell by mosquitos in there so please make sure you use a repellant. Very easy transfer from marco polo \approx 10 minute walk to pier waterbus company alilugana drop on canal right by hotel just a walk over the rialto and reasonable rate of 25 euros per person return. In all venice is so beautiful but i would advise to visit out of season prob may or sept/oct as so very busy in july jam packed with holidaymakers and esp day trippers

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in the heart of all the action!”
Reviews.Author: anilutta
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel located right opposite the Rialto Bridge. Perfect location if you like to be where the action is ! Great hotel, beautifully decorated and well maintained. View the canal from the dining room and as soon as you step out of the hotel you have numerous canal side restaurants and right opposite the Rialto Bridge. The hotel threw in a guided tour to a glass factory in Murano as a complementary add-on for all guests staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Locatio, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Les_Elaine
Reviews.Content: I suupose you have a choice when booking a hotel in Venice, spend similar amounts of money on a hotel close to the centre which isn't too plush but is ok as a base, or a hotel out of the centre which is a bit more plush but means you travelling into the centre every day. We chose the former. The hotel's loaction is perfect. Some may prefer closer to St Mark's square but that is at one end of the islands so walking around Venice is a bit further. We hardly used the water buses prefering to get lost in the back streets but in 4 days we covered every area of the city. The hotel itself is clean, our room was really nice, the staff were very friendly and it's not too difficult to find. We decided to walk from the bus station at 11.30pm. It took us about half an hour but we found the hotel with only a few back tracks, and it was our first time in Venice. Others have commented on the breakfast and, yes, it is limited but if you go expecting that, it's no problem. As mentioned early, we could have booked a 4* hotel in Mestre for about the same money but I think we made the right decision. Really enjoyed our stay there and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and adequate hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MarkiePAshford
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my wife - we wanted an affordable hotel in a central location and that's certainly what we got. The hotel is very basic but clean and the check in staff were friendly and spoke good enough english. The room is OK - a bit small facing a brick wall and the air con didn't seem to work. However, the location is fantastic - 100 yards from the Rialto Bridge with views of the Grand Canal from the breakfast room. If you want a fancy hotel then this isn't for you but if you're after affordability and location it's difficult to beat.

Reviews.Title: “lovely location, feel at home”
Reviews.Author: aplund
Reviews.Content: gerat location near Ponte Rialto. Friendly staff, warm atmosphere and lovely view of canal grande. You really feel like a guest in someones home.

Reviews.Title: “As advertised and a little bit more...”
Reviews.Author: TheMcKenna
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we knew we were going to be happy we chose Locando Ovidius. Eliza checked us in with a cheerful smile & personality. We'd booked an economy room which was a bit small for us & opted to upgrade to a canal view for what was to us a fair price. It was worth it to open the shutters & see the Rialto Bridge just 100 or so meters away. The bathroom was a good size & standard standard amenities were provided; however ours didn't have a shower, just a big tub & a hand-held shower hose. I'm sure they work for most people, just not me that's all I'm saying. We took advantage of the continental breakfast included with our rate; it had the basics and was more than satisfactory. Given Venice can be a bit pricey, it's a nice option to have. Great location, easily found by just following the Rialto signs. Arrived during Carnival so moving around the city was an exercise in patience. The rooms & common areas are fairly represented on the website. No more than a 10-minute walk to San Marco & less than 5 to the Rialto market. Be sure to watch prices in the restaurants by the hotel; they'll do their best to pull you in and are not affiliated with the hotel. We found 2 others just as good, if not better for about 1/3 the price. It's not a glamorous hotel, but that's not what they advertise to be and our expectations were pleasantly exceeded. Overall we found the 3-star rating to be solid & deserved with the only concern being the bed was too soft for us. But we had a 4+-star stay! This was down to Eliza and every other staff member making us feel welcome. All staff were attentive when we asked for information & guidance, the hotel & our room were clean, as were the linens & towels and my wife & I agreed we were not disappointed and we believe you won't be either. If we're ever back in Venice, this is where we'll be.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: stokepete
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here in February, as stated previously, the hotel location is great, liked the public balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. Rooms small but as expected in Venice, we had 109 which had a window that opened out to a wall, we didn't mind as we didnt go to Venice for the hotel room and only really slept there. Breakfast I found quite poor, even for a continental affair, but again this was not a problem as there is plenty of cafes around the area to get food. I'd stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “great charming small hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: marianne77
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 nights in november in this small but charming hotel. the reception was very welcoming, helpful and friendly, they even kept our luggage stored after check out the last day. the hotel has a balcony overlooking the grand canal wich any guest can use, the breakfast room also overlooks the canal... the breakfast was good, there was an elevator also. the rooms are clean, venetian style with wallpaper & murano glass chandelier. we had the standard room with no view, it was not small by european standards, and we didn't spend time in the room, so we didn't care about the view. if you book directly with the hotel, you can use the wifi for free, we actually used it with our mobile phone and had no problem. we loved this hotel, the location was great and we could walk around all venice if we wanted. we tried the restaurant downstairs the hotel by the grand canal and it was the best we found in venice. you can use the san silvestro vaporetto stop better than rialto stop if you don't want to pass by bridges and stairs. the hotel rates are very good compared to their location. i would defenitly return back when in venice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, great location, spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: Janderra
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 7 nights. It is a small hotel right next to the Rialto bridge on San Palo side. We were probably very lucky as we booked a Superior room with no view and we were given one of the 2 Grand Canal Suites. The room was huge and looked out to the canal, but the terrace outside, (which anyone can use), overlooking the Rialto bridge is stunning. Breakfast was quite good with fresh coffee etc. The fridge in our room didnt work well but they delivered ice to our room every afternoon. The free internet wasnt working but they let me use the computer at reception. The hotel is a little oldfashioned but all the more charming. The bed was very comfortable and a bargain at the 95 euro we paid. I would definately recommend because of location, view and service, and cleaniness

Reviews.Title: “Quaint & friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: agwp
Reviews.Content: I picked Hotel Ovidius because of a good deal through an agent and the location. I was let down by the deal but the location was absolutelty perfect. Because we booked through an agency and not direct with the hotel we were shown to a broom cupboard of a roomw ith no natural light and decor from the 1960s. my wife cried and after complaining we were offered an upgrade to the honeymoon suite with a view over the river for an extra 140 euro for 4 nights. The rooms are very small and basic. the breakfast is disappointing with a choice of bread and cheese or cereal. Howvever the staff are very accomodating and friendly. We were always greeted with big smiles and they did everything they could to make us feel comfortable. We paid approx 130 euros per night and I checked some other hotels the same distance from the Rialto bridge and couldn't find one less than 180 euros per night. We would stay there again as it's only a 10 minute walk from St Marcs square and 1 moinute walk to the bridge. But my advice is book your room directly with the hotel! Also go to the beach in Lido if you have time. Venice is just simply beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: hayleybailey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Locanda Ovidius and was very pleased with the location. Was overlooking the grande canal and could see the Riallto bridge from the dining room. The room wasnt too good though, was tiny, could barely move, the bed was pushed up against a wall so had to jump over the bed to get into it. When we went to open the window there was a wall directly in front so had no light what so ever, we had the light on constantly, which wasnt too nice when the sun was shining outside. Bathroom was ok, nothing special. Breakfast was quite nice, typical Italian food (cheese, bread, yoghurts etc.) The best thing about the hotel was definatly the location, was only 10 minute walk to St Marks Square and only a few minutes to the shops, was loads of lovely restaurants around the hotel aswell. Would recommend this hotel but think we were just unlucky with our room, all the others seemed lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: vangleo
Reviews.Content: Great Location!!! Just next to the Rialto Birdge, overlooking the Grand Canal and in a close walking distance to the main attractions! Hotel staff was very nice and the hotel was very clean. The only "disappointment" was the size of the rooms. But in Venice you cant expect spacious rooms (especially in 3 star hotels). That part of the city is always very busy! Dont expect something very quite during the day, but we didn't have any problems due to noise. I would recommend this hotel to anyone !

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel in perfect location, would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: thegoodlife95
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and the location was perfect. Close enough to all the attractions and San Marco but far enough away that it wasn't noisy. Hotel is right on the Canal Grande and you can see the famous Rialto Bridge from the breakfast room balcony. Venice is a great romantic place to visit if you havent been before. Rooms clean but small - chic boutique decor very charming. Top tips for Venice - use the water ferries which are cheap and easy, save a little for a gondola ride (best in hours of darkness) as its a once in a life time experience, don't bother with the famous Harry's Bar (20 euros a drink and definately not worth it), eat seafood by the canal (best ive tasted), visit Rialto market early morning, be prepared to get your feet wet but it's part of the fun. Would go back, just with more Â£ next time.

Reviews.Title: “Near the busiest region”
Reviews.Author: antartoo
Reviews.Content: Easy to find especially for travellers first time to Venice (like us), it's a 3 mins walk from the Rialto bridge along the canal. Room was bigger than we expected, facing the alley but we put on the blinds anyway, could pay more to have the room facing the canal. We enjoyed the canal view from the balcony of the breakfast room. Staff were very friendly. Free wifi at the hotel reception. The jacuzzi bath tub could have been cleaner though.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Milson
Reviews.Content: stayed 7-20 march hotel room adequate, clean, next to lounge so made good use of balcony. if you go to venice, this is the hotel to use.... close to all sights, and round corner from market. staff very good, nothing is a problem. if planning a visit... double your planned amount of money you are to take... this place IS the most expensive place in europe.... 4.5 euros for a bog standard coffee, 6 euros for a pint,,,, and 1.5 euros to 'spend a penny' I kid you not! worth seeing the city... and not to be missed

Reviews.Title: “Fanatastic location and service”
Reviews.Author: AnnoymousUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our stay. I'm the kind of person who likes 5* hotels, but being in Venice, my budget couldn't quite afford it.! However, this hotel is perfect for a 2-3 night stay. The location is ideal and probably the best service I've ever experienced. Room is fine (lots of character) and the price is fair. The only downside to it all is the breakfast, but it certainly wouldn't put me off staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel spoilt by lots of noisy youngsters”
Reviews.Author: MagsG
Reviews.Content: Good hotel.Wonderful views onto Grand Canal if pay 50 euros extra a night to upgrade. Our stay was entirely spoilt by group of rude American teenagers accompanied by a teacher,who partied ,shouted, banged doors and smoked and drank alcohol, right next to our room until 2.30am in the morning,who seemed to get ruder and louder every time we tried to complain. the management seemed to do nothing about the situation,saying only that we were probably young once!.Our enjoyment of Venice slightly marred because feeling constantly tired. Another minor point,although room itself was large and well appointed ,there was no shower curtain,so the floor flooded every time we had a shower!

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Expected”
Reviews.Author: Judy1954
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Locanda Ovidius for 2 nights in October. What a wonderful location for seeing everything that we had planned. The hotel is just steps from the Rialto Bridge with all kinds of restaurants and shopping. Check in and out went smoothly. We were early and our room was not ready, but we were able to leave our bags in their luggage room and start our sight seeing. Room was a little small, but typical of most of the European hotels we have stayed in. The room and bath were very clean and well maintained. Small but functioning elevator which was one of the reasons we booked this property. Very good breakfast of cold meats, cheese, various types of bread, pastries and cereals. Milk, coffee, juices and hot chocolate were available. If you want to take a gondola ride, there are 2 locations (one in each direction from the hotel) that are just a minute or so walk. We loved having a cup of coffee in the morning or a glass of wine at night on the small balcony overlooking the grand canal. We would most definitely choose this hotel again for a trip back to Venice

Reviews.Title: “Have a break in venice”
Reviews.Author: susan_2288
Reviews.Content: A superb place to stay in venice. Hotel very clean, friendly, quiet,comfortable,& relaxed. Stayed for four nights. Looking out On the balcony we had a wonderful view of venice . We would stay at this hotel again, its one of the best. Restaurants can be a rip off so be careful, one of the best was Trattorie BRUNO, close to the Hotel Bruno. The food and service was fab. If you have a quick drink at a bar be careful as they charge you double just for sitting down outside. Venice is a maze, shops, bars, restaurants etc so if you see a specific shop dont expect to go back the next day to find it as we never could, a really beautiful city. The hotel is really easy to find just a short ride away from p.roma to rialito bridge, so when we often got lost just ask for the bridge people will always help. Mureno and bureno well worth a trip, but dont rush back because the vapperitoes buses are always ful and we had to wait for another hour before we could catch the next one. The lace factory was under restoration and the museum at the jewish ghetto was closed. A lovely trip, not to expensive, weather very hot, mosquito bites all over legs and arms, take a repellent just in case.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: himselfetc
Reviews.Content: +ve; Good location near Rialto, Friendly staff. -ve: No complimentary internet access in rooms, nothing in rooms at all really apart from furniture. Bathroom flooded when shower was used. Rooms overlooking Grand Canal can be noisy

Reviews.Title: “It was great !!”
Reviews.Author: twosons2
Reviews.Content: Our room was very cozy. There was 2 double beds for us, my hudsband, me and two sons. Staffs were kind and tryed to give us lots of information. The location is fantastic. We can see grand canal and Rialto bridge through two big window in our room. I want to strongly recommand this hotel to people who go to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: villamartin
Reviews.Content: My Daughter & I stayed here in December, we had a very good welcome, & shown to our room on the 2nd floor. It was a very pretty room albeit small. The location is perfect right by the Rialto Bridge, with all its streetside bars & restaurants. From the outside it looks dreadful & when we got off the water taxi I nearly died. The inside is what counts & we had no complaints the staff very friendly & breakfast not lots of choice but good, for the price we paid I would certainly go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: vills
Reviews.Content: This hotel is steps away from the Rialto Bridge, facing the Grand Canal. It's in the center of a strip of restaurants that have tables on the canals. It's a great location to start exploring the city. There are good places nearby to eat, buy souvenirs, get some gelato, and take a gondola ride. The staff of the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The room itself is beautifully decorated and clean. It was small, but not nearly as small as some European hotels. The bathroom had a wonderful jacuzzi bath tub. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a pleasant and affordable hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting vacation”
Reviews.Author: Maureenruler
Reviews.Content: In February those of us who do not have a very large budget can afford to stay in wonderful locations such as the dreamy Hotel locanda Ovidius. Situated right in the historic and architectural heart of the old town, starting with the picture postcard famous Rialto Bridge a stone throw away, it boasts views over the Grand Canal from its two balconies and its very pretty 18th century style breakfast room (scrummy breakfast! hot croissants, or anything you may wish!). You can stroll out in the evening and enjoy a delicious romantic meal on the waterfront just a few steps away, even in winter... Explore the main venues and maze of alleyways on foot from this location: you can always rely on on being given a warm welcome on your return as well as the ability to order a cappucino to enjoy on the balcony gazing at the gondolas and the water buses. Finally retire to your traditionally styled bedroom for a peaceful night and look forward to another amazing day.

Reviews.Title: “Good for it's rating”
Reviews.Author: adamandcara
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the locanda Ovidius for three nights in November 2007. We stayed in a double room over looking the Rialto. A lovely hotel in a good location, with exceptional views and spacious rooms. Had room 102 which had an awful shower (no water pressure and temperature a little varied) my sister had room 101 which had a lovely bath which I was able to use however. The rooms could do with a little more storage space as the cupboards in the room are only spare beds we found and none of the draws open. Overall I would say the hotel was sufficient for it's money and we got a good nights sleep, with lovely views and had a wonderful time in Venice. The hotel offers a free trip to Muarano to see the glass being made which is worth seeing. I would recommend getting a ticket for the water buses and just riding around on them to see the sights of Venice from the water as they are incrediable and after 3 days of not seeing a car you will feel slightly wary of them when you get back.

Reviews.Title: “Reflection”
Reviews.Author: cheshiresilverfox
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights in room 202, which is a very good sized room overlooking the canal, with a generous bathroom. The view is undoubtely spectacular, but came at a supplementary cost of Euro 100 per night. The location is ideal - near to the Rialto bridge (less than 60 metres) very close to the waterbus stops (opposite the hotel) and within a comfortable walking distance of St Mark's Square etc etc. The hotel also has two small balconies overlooking the canal, one accessed through a rather small dining area and the other through an equally small sitting area. The reception area is microscopic. To all intents and purposes, therefore, what you get in the Locandia Ovidius is a room in a pleasant hotel that is ideally located for getting around the City. At extra cost you get a fantastic outlook onto the Grand Canal. All parts of the hotel are clean. The 3* rating is an accurate assessment of the facilities that are available. The reception staff were pleasant and helped whenever asked. We only saw one other person - a lady who took care of things at breakfast, but who we actually saw little of. Bizarrely in this day and age the hotel expected all extras to be paid in cash. Not quite sure what is going on there. This is something I've only experienced once before since the 1960s - and that was in a non-tourist hotel in the outskirts of Moscow in the very early post-Communism days! Also bizarre, and reminiscent of Ealing Comedy style boarding houses you are presented with a list of rules that you have to agree to by signing the bottom of the list. The breakfast is unimaginative but adequate - bread rolls, cold meats, cheese, croissants, muesli, yoghurt pots etc with juice and a choice of tea and coffee. Our trip was a much appreciated 'thank you' gift from my son and daughter-in-law. It was a good choice of hotel on their part and we both came home refreshed having had five great days in what is a most beautiful city. I would use the hotel again, but would want to stay in one of the superior rooms overlooking the canal. The scoring matrix to rate the overall experience only allows 1 to 5. My rating of the overall experience is 4. My rating for the hotel in isolation is 3.5.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend the Ovidius”
Reviews.Author: Oct2ber
Reviews.Content: Booked a standard double room, but must have been upgraded as the room we were given far exceeded our expectations. Large room with lovely spacious bathroom. Overlooked the Grand Canal, for far less money than you would normally pay for a canal view in Venice. Everything was very clean. Breakfast was very good, continental style. Hotel staff very friendly. Good location but beware of poor quality overpriced tourist restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Just as all the reviews said!”
Reviews.Author: dund22
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Ovidius for three nights at the end of September. Had read many of the reviews of the Hotel on trip advisor, and they weren't too far wrong! Booked the room through the hotel website, which worked out much cheaper. Arrived there before check in time at 2pm, but were allowed to leave bags in storage until we came back. Staff were very professional and helpful from check in through to when we were leaving. Room was bigger than I was expecting, very clean and comfortable. Hairdryer isn't much use though! Breakfast was lovely, you could eat as much as you wanted. The breakfast room was quite small, but we always got a table, and the views are amazing. Couldn't fault this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel overlookng the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: StevieCheshire
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a fantastic location which we preferred to St Marks Square! Get the water bus from the airport and get off at the Rialto stop 12 euros and the hotel is directly opposite. Breakfast room and lounge overlooks the Grand Canal and Rialto Bridge as do a few bedrooms. We had a side bedroom with no view but for the time we were in it, it was no problem. Room had all the usual facilities; TV, mini fridge, hairdryer. Staff very friendly and happy to provide us with an early breakfast on day of departure as we had an early flight. Couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Canal magic”
Reviews.Author: JR_ZA
Reviews.Content: The smallest room on our Europe Tour, but also the most expensive. Not all rooms have a canal view. On arrival your passport is taken for validation with the Police. Wasn't comfortable with the practice, but aparently standard practice in Venice hotels..? We were provided a set of rules (in French which I don't understand), almost hostel like and treating you like a child. You have to sign it. Otherwise a pleasant experience. At night time we could overlook the Grand Canal from the Breakfast room balcony - a magical experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: scallywag50
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Venice and we fell in love with it. The hotel was clean and comfortable with friendly and helpful staff. We stayed in room 203 which was a very large double with en-suite overlooked a quaint side street. We loved the views from the breakfast room from which we could see the Rialto bridge. We'd definately recommend this hotel and would be more than happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: ivy53
Reviews.Content: Venice, Italy Hotel Locanda Ovidius Very close to the Rialto Bridge Date: July 2007 Reviewer: Trip Advisor Traveler It was our first time traveling to Venice, and after hours of walking we were tired and frustrated. No one had mentioned that the Grand Canal was closed because there was new bridge being built. No one was willing to help. I had to leave my two daughters in a corner watching our luggage while I walked up and down the sides of the Canal trying to get info on how to get to the hotel. But once we made it there, around 12 midnight, we found ourselves in a small but very clean and air conditioned room. We had a problem with the third bed and the reception clerk came right away to fix it. Breakfast is served in a small dinning room by a lovely lady who will gladly prepare your favorite morning beverage. Nice selection of breads, ham, cheese, juices, cereal, etc. It was enough to get us going. At the reception desk, Mr. Moreno and Ms Lucia were an absolute delight. Extremely helpful. Gave us information about what we asked and more. Lucia even called a water taxi for us to take us to Murano to one of the glass factories. We were leaving Venice on that day and if it wasn't for her we would not have been able to go to the islands of Murano and Burano. When we came back from Burano, we were all wet and they allowed us to use the restrooms facilities to change clothes. They held our luggage for us all day at no cost. The hotel is small but is clean, quiet and if you want to be by the Rialto Bridge, it is a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “What an Idealic Position near to the Rialto Bridge”
Reviews.Author: Officiado
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Venice as our Daughter last Year was on Tour as a Chorister at Salisbury Cathedral and this year on Tour as a Chorister at Lancing College. The Hotel was very central for all the places we needed to visit and within walking distance to many different restaurants to explore and sample. The staff are all very pleasant and helpful, and most speak good English.The breakfast was just what we had expected Croissants Jam and Honey and Cheese and Salami, with a good choice of Fruit Juices and Cereals. We had a lovely room overlooking to our left The Rialto Bridge. The Room was very clean and the beds very comfortable. With the 90% Humidity we were very grateful that the air conditioning worked very well. A very reasonably priced Hotel which completely fitted all our requirements. If we go back to Venice again which we would very much like to, we would definately stay there again. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay !!”
Reviews.Author: OnwardThruTheFog
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here, rooms were excellent, old Venitian decor. They were nice enough to upgrade us for our anniversary to a room overlooking the Grand Canal. Staff were very helpful and a lot of fun to talk to, also met some very interesting people at night on the upstairs balcony having cappacinos overlooking the canal. Great location right by the Rialto, go to Harry's Bar, probably the most expensive bellini you'll have but the atmosphere is fun, stand at the bar and watch the show.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GANTY
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Locanda Ovidius. The best part by far is the location. Right by the Rialto bridge and above some very nice restaurants on the Grand Canal itself. We had room 301 which is not for the unfit or larger framed people - it's in the attic with stairs to get up to the front door and then a small winding staircase to get from the second level where the bathroom is situated to the top floor where the bedroom is. We found it interesting and different! the rooms were nice and clean. The balcony areas are nice and we sat out there one night with a Prosecco nightcap out of the mini-bar in our room. The staff were friendly and helpful and breakfast gets you off to a good start with cereal, croissants etc.. Overall a nice 3* hotel which I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Unscrupulous business people”
Reviews.Author: Kalaloo
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms for June 11 &12th. We had to cancel our reservations. Their reservations states clearly that you must cancel 11 days in advanced or you may be charged for one night's fees. SO.. I cancelled 12 days in advance, and recieved a notification for my request to cancel on the same day. they took 2 days to send a confirmation of my cancellation, and they said because they did not confirm my cancellation for 2 days that I would be charged for the rooms $500 dollars! Ripoff! do not stay here! Booked by VeniceBy.com/ and WorldBy.com they have been trying to help me. Sad customer!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and perfectly situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: westergolford
Reviews.Content: You can pay a lot for a view of the Rialto, but we went for the cheap option and had a fine view of the sky. The upside of this was that we were on the same floor as the breakfast room which has a balcony opening onto the Grand Canal and is empty and secluded from 1100 onwards...so it was as good as having a canal view at half the price...cheapskates! Room was basic with a shower only..we expected a tub...but it was clean, comfortable and the staff were great. Good breakfast...24 hour access and just across from the Rialto Vaporetto stop so handy for the Orange line Alilaguna to and from Marco Polo airport (12â‚¬). Best of all its a few steps walk from the Rialto Fish market...not to be missed in the morning if you like to see real city life. Eat at the Diavolo e l'aquasanta just around the corner...great food, atmosphere and price. Overall...all hotels in Venice are expensive but this was worth it all round, and pretty good value. Best of all was the location and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Services, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Traveler094
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Hotel Ovidius in April 07. From the staff to the cleanliness to the amenities, everything was excellent. The location is overlooking the Grand Canal next to the Rialto Bridge, this puts you right in the thick of excellent restaurants and shopping. The room itself was large and accomodating. I probably sound like a commercial for the hotel but we had such a great experience with the staff's helpfulness with dining reservations and internet service and breakfast and sightseeing directions and whatever we needed, I feel I owe it to them to spread the word. This was our first trip to Venice and we had the trip of a life time - our hotel wound up being one of the major reasons why.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: MMOuellette
Reviews.Content: Breakfast rocked, (continental) Coffee was amazing...There is a common balcony that everyone can hang out and view... its beautiful ... a view of the grand canal. Close to Water Taxis, Water metro, close to everything... Nice morning market nearby. Concierge service was to be desired at times.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Strider687
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location near to the Rialto Bridge which is a perfect base to explore Venice from. Upon arrival we were offered a room with a view of the Grand Canal for 40 euros per night, we declined as we had read on this site that it may be noisy. Our room (107) overlooked a side alley and was small but adequate. However the bed was uncomfortable for us. The room was in need of some minor repairs but nothing that spoilt our stay. Breakfast was continental and was very nice and fresh, it made for a good start to the day. The staff were friendly and helpful although the night porter did not know very much. Overall a lovely stay if only the bed had been better for a good nights sleep. We booked the room via Easyjet and got an excellent rate. We recommend the Alilaguna boat from the airport 12 euros to St Marks Square (San Marco) or 6 euros to Fondemente Nove. There is a 10 minute walk from each stop but both are lovely. We also took the Original Walking tour (20 euros each) and well worth the money and Original Canal tour (40 euros each) this was a good tour but appeared a little over priced. Gondolas from Rialto were 80 euros a pleasant trip but only 1/2 and hour long.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Miti81
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last August, we booked after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor and I want to say a big Thank you for everyone who reviewed this hotel. We were not disappointed. The hotel is in a perfect location, the room was clean and very comfortable, reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The only negative point was that the coffee at breakfast wasnt great but that is a minor detail when you are having breakfast in room with the view of Grand Canal and Rialto bridge. The hotel is easy to find and very close to a waterbus station and we didnt have any problem travelling with our suitcase. We had a great time in Venice and I absolutely Love this city.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Locanda Ovidius”
Reviews.Author: Angel0
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a reasonably priced but excellently located hotel, then this is the one for you. The rooms are clean and comfortable (if in need of a little repair), the staff are all incredibly helpful and friendly and the buffet breakfast is very good. The view from the two balconies can only be described as magnificent. I would definitely recommend this hotel, just as long as you are not expecting anything too flashy. With regard to local eateries, I can definitely recommend 'Sacro e Profano' which serves up excellent food in a cosy atmosphere at a very reasonable price. However, do not under any circumstances visit 'Taverna San Lio' , as the food here is overpriced and inedible while the waiter who served my girlfriend and I was continuously bringing us things to eat and drink which we had not ordered and then expected us to pay for them! Also, make sure you take a gondola ride-it is worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Locanda Ovidius a little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Paul003
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day stay in this Hotel, nothing in Venice is cheap but this hotel seems to be the exception.. The Staff were always friendly.. we arrived about an hour early and couldn't check in but we were allowed to leave our bags and they recommended a restaurant a short walk behind the Hotel which turned out to be one of the best meals we had during our stay. The Hotel is small, only about 12 rooms in total and they have 2 types of room, the economy and "the rooms with a view" as they call it.. so that is something to watch out for when you are shopping around for prices on the internet.. we got a really good price but it turned out to be an economy room at the side of the hotel with a view of a back street.. the room itself was quite small but quite adequate about 11' x 11' and had a small shower room attached. The room was spotlessly clean and as we only ever use our hotel room as a base and somewhere to sleep we would of been quite happy staying there but as it was a special occasion and had the chance to upgrade on our second night which we took advantage of it. The upgrade room had the view of the Grand Canal and was larger than our first and also had the benefit of a bathroom with Jacuzzi. Again the room was spotlessly clean and for the price couldn't be faulted. the downside of the upgrade was that the Grand Canal can get quite noisy . but not so noisy that it kept us awake there is also a restaurant on the ground floor of the Hotel which goes out onto the walkway and again this can get a little noisy when they are packing the tables away at around midnight.. but the room is double glazed and cuts the noise down to about 10% - that is the only downside we found. The Breakfast room is on the second floor and our room was right next to the kitchen, also on the second floor but the only reason we knew it was there was the fact that we were woken up each morning at 7am by the smell of freshly baked croissants. The Mini Bar prices are much the same if not cheaper than the prices in the bars on Venice. Visit the Hotels Website for a great map on how to find the Hotel A few prices during our stay in March 2007 Airport to St. Marks bus = 12 euro Local water bus for 60 minutes = 6 Euro Gondola for 40 minutes = 80 Euro Water Taxi from Hotel to Airport = 90 Euro

Reviews.Title: “hotel ovidius january break”
Reviews.Author: rozsalind
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 4 day break in venice (23rd jan07 we stayed in the hotel ovidius right next to the rialto bridge on the grand canal , after reading one review about the total non smoking ban in the hotel i was a bit concerned being a smoker but as it turned out they now allow smoking on the first floor balcony , which turns out to be the best view of the canal and rialto bridge where you can watch all the commings and goings ,the balcony is furnished with comfortable seats as well ! the hotel was compact but clean , the room although quite small had everything we needed . we were in a room that overlooked the alley to the side of the hotel but if you want to pay for an upgrade you can have one overlooking the rialto, although a couple of times when i couldnt sleep i found myself on the smoking balcony at 5 in the morning and it was quite noisy so i dont know how this would affect you in a front room. we enjoyed venice with the exception of the weather. rain on the first day sun on the second .hail ,snow and wind on day 3 we were freezing so a furthur visit would be around june time . we found plenty of places to eat but not very freindly staff in any place we visited , we found the italians arogant and very rude , especially if you didnt order at least 3 courses and bottles of wine they didnt want to know you and walked away never to be seen untill it was time to pay the bill we have been to rome and found it to be a totaly different experience ,and would go back tomorrow but venice is not a place i would return to in a hurry and certainly not in january where most places were shut, and very very expensive , the holiday was a present so we had no control over the time of year unfortunatley , but just the attitude of the italians put us off going again overall the hotel and its staff were great and i would recomend the hotel and location

Reviews.Title: “Great location, smallish room, nice decor - sbut mokers beware!”
Reviews.Author: vlopresto
Reviews.Content: I booked well in advance directly from the hotel website, asking for a smoking room. They confirmed by reservation. When we arrived, one of the first things we were told is there is absolutely no smoking anywhere in the hotel (they told everyone that). It was not such a problem for me but I know heavy smokers who would have had a very big problem with this. It kind of ruined my time at the hotel, craving a cigarette sonstantly. The room was very small but nice. Venetian fabric wall coverings and antique furniture - very nice. But a very modern bathroom. But the beds were as hard as a rock! Just awful. You actually bruised your hips turning over at night! The breakfast was OK - pretty typical, no hot food, cheese, meat, croissants. The location is wonderful, right near the Rialto. Get off the vaporetto as San Sebastiano (I think that's the name - the stop after Rialto) as it leaves you on the right side of the Canal Grande. The staff were helpful and friendly. I'd stay again if I quit smoking and have a years worth of chiropractor treatment first!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: briden
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice on a very hot day in September. Upon checking in, I jokingly asked Sebastiano, the hotel attendant if the A/C was already cranking in the room. He assured me it was. We went out to dinner only to find that it wasn't working. I told the on-duty hotel clerk and he said it wouldn't be fixed until the next morning. So there we were, exhausted and hot with a deluxe room facing the Grand Canal and no A/C. My husband and I could not sleep b/c of the heat so I went downstairs and asked for 2 bottles of water and a bucket of ice. As we sucked on ice cubes throughout the night, we were never able to get a wink of sleep. This was due to the high temperatures in the room and when we had the windows open, the noise from the vaporettos was unbearable. We couldn't help thinking what a way to start off our trip. At 7am the next morning I went downstairs and asked that we get some money credited back to us b/c in my eyes, having no A/C takes a hotel down at least one star. They refused and even tried charging me for the 2 bottles of water we drank the night before. Later that day I took this problem up with Sebastiano and he proceeded to tell us that the A/C breaking was not his fault, it was the machines fault. I told him he was a reflection of the hotel and it was his job to make sure the hotel guests were comfortable. He must have told me 3 or 4 times that it was the machines fault and if the rooms were overbooked then maybe that would be his fault. I asked to speak to a manager/owner and he said he never comes in and is only available by phone. I demanded he ask the manager to take some money off the room for that one night. After a day of sightseeing we came back to find out they discounted it 15 euros. We told him it was a slap in the face but weren't going to argue this lost cause anymore. We went upstairs to our room only to find that the A/C had been fixed but a piece of furniture (ottoman) was missing from our room. Lovely, huh? BTW - whomever says the bathrooms of this place are gorgeous are out of their minds. We had a deluxe room with a Grand Canal view and our shower was a tiny 2 ft. x 2 ft. square, no kidding. The hair dryer was a reversible vacuum hose that blew out cold air. Maybe we should've used it to cool oursleves off the night before. (J/K) The bottom line is that this hotel has horrible customer service and refuses to be accountable for anything that goes wrong with the hotel. Hospitality and common courtesy was clearly missing with this hotel staff (except for the nice guy at 4am who gave us the bucket of ice to cool us off). Why would anyone want to take the risk of staying at this hotel knowing it can clearly change your outlook of your vacation???

Reviews.Title: “Such a warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: Pugwash666
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say that the warm welcome and friendly attention to any request was such a refreshing change. Venice is, of course, a beautiful City but the warmth from all the Staff at Locanda Ovidius really made our stay a pleasure. Stay away from the big hotels. This small, and perfectly formed, hotel was the best and, being on the Grand Canal, a few yards from the Rialto Bridge, made it the perfect central site (away from the rip-offs of St Marks Square-leave that for those with more money than sense)!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Experience!”
Reviews.Author: vib
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel from the minute we checked in. The staff, particularly Sebastiano, was wonderful, friendly, and helpful. The rooms and bathrooms were clean and spacious. Location and view can't be beat. Breakfast was delicious. Price was very reasonable. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place & Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: GLBTRT
Reviews.Content: This place was a surprise! The location was absolutely great... very close to the Rialto Bridge. The staff was always very helpful, and funny! Great rooms, decorated well. Wonderful balcony overlooking the grand canal, and a breakfast room with a view, too! Overall, we were very pleased with this hotel and would recommend it for those who are looking for a quaint place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: UT_Mars
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a business trip to Venice, and stayed at this hotel for six nights. The first five nights were fine. The room was basic, but adequate, and the location is central. On the last afternoon I was there, I came back from a very hot afternoon of post-meeting touring, looking forward to relaxing before dinner in my air conditioned room. But the room was hot as a sauna, and the remote control for the air conditioner was missing. I spoke to the receptionist, and she told me that all the rooms on my floor had lost air conditioning (strange, since they were independent, wall-mounted units) and that the repairs would not be made until the next morning. I told her this would create a problem for me because I was leaving very early the next morning and I absolutely had to get a good night's sleep before my long (20-plus hour) trip home the next day. Air conditioning (as advertised on the hotel web page) was one of the reasons I picked this hotel. I had used it all of the previous five nights, and knew I would need it again my last night, so I asked to be moved to a room on a different floor that had working a/c. She told me the hotel was booked up, so she couldn't move me. I said that was fine, but I needed the a/c, so I asked her to arrange to put me up in another hotel that had a/c for my last night. She said she would not. Then I told her, fine, I will just check out a day early and find another hotel room on my own, and she said if I did that, they would still charge me for my last night because they have a 10-day cancellation period. I asked to speak to the owner or manager about the situation three separate times during our conversation, and each time she refused, saying "they will just tell you the same thing." She absolutely refused to take responsibility for the broken a/c - she kept saying it was not their fault. While I certainly agree that they would not have intentionally broken the a/c, in my view, a hotel is responsible for providing guests with accomodations as-advertised, and if something prevents them from doing this, they need to find alternate arrangements for the guest. Later in the afternoon, the receptionist handed me a memo from the manager saying that because of my inconvenience, they would offer me 15% off my next stay at their hotel. I told her the memo was just silly and handed it back to her. I've only been to Venice twice in my life (including this time) and have no plans to come back there in the forseeable future. Even if I did, I would not stay with them again. I was not looking for financial gain from this situation, only a good night's sleep that night. That night, I tried to sleep with the window open, but didn't get any sleep - just laid there on top of my sweat-soaked sheets. Even a prescription sleep aid did not help. The air in the facing alleyway was hot, so the room never cooled to a reasonable temperature, and there were kids bouncing a ball in the alley that was very loud with the window open. Several buzzing insects (probably mosquitos) came in through the screenless window throughout the night, adding to the misery. The worst was the following day, trying to fly back to the U.S. on no sleep at all. In summary, avoid this place if customer service is even slightly important to you. They won't so much as lift a finger to correct a problem, and they'll give you a rude attitude on top of it. I've never been in a situation where I've repeatedly asked to speak with a manager and simply been flat-out refused. There are enough other hotels in Venice at this price point and with good locations that there's really no reason to choose Locanda Ovidius.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very unprofessional in their handling of customers. Upon arrival, and we arrived only 1 hour before checkin requesting a room, we were denied a room (and rooms were available). We arrived 55 minutes later, five minutes before check in, and they still would not present us with our room. While this is in accordance with their policy, I have never been forced to wait an additional five minutes, as if something major would change in that period. And I have travelled all over the world, both for business and personal. Additionally, they claimed to have given us an "upgrade" to our room, which was a loft on the 3rd floor which included a set of revolving stairs WITHIN the hotel room itself. Not only was this an annoyance, it became a monotonous chore. Also, upon checkout, when a receipt was requested, they were not able to present one at time of request. While the room we stayed in was "average" there are tons of over priced places to stay in Venice, so feel free to look around before settling here. I would have stayed here again had the service not been so poor (and thats just the big things that stick out). At time of departure, I almost wanted to ask for the Euro cash payment back just to pay more to put it on my AMEX card just so that they would lose money in the process. In overpriced, touristy Venezia, the location and price was worth it, however give Venezia a second glance before jumping at this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent a Romantic few days at the Ovidius Hotel. All you coiuld ask for - helpful staff, great breakfast, good company. pleasant guests, large very clean ornate rooms, murina glass everywhere, fabulous restaurants metres away and a room overlooking the canal with a view to die for. What more can I say SENSATIONAL.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: quiltingtravelmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in March. Did not book a room with canal view, but we asked to be upgraded at check in. The extra Euros were well spent in my opinion. We were shown 2 rooms to choose from before we made our decision. One had a jacuzzi. The other was a bit larger, but no jacuzzi. We chose room 102 and were very comfortable there. It was hard to pull ourselves away from the windows! This was our first time in Venice, so it was fascinating to watch the different boats on the canal. Carnivale had ended the day before we arrived, so the city was not very crowded. There are three or four restaurants in front of the hotel (on the Grand Canal). Prices varied from 14 Euros for 2 courses to 80 Euros for fish and pasta! Make sure you know the price before you order! We loved being able to explore Venice in the day time and then enjoy a meal by the hotel at night, so we didn't have to wander far after dark. Breakfast was more than adequate - Italian salami, croissants, tea, coffee, yoghurt, cereal, etc. The staff were always friendly and helpful. They even brought tea to our room the last day because we had to checkout before breakfast hours. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a room that overlooked the street. The staff were friendly and helpful. There is an elevator. The location is excellent with a water bus station fairly close. Our room was large for Europe and very comfortable. There are several restarunts nearby, be careful aand watch the prices though. We had there couples staying at the hotel and everyone liked their rooms. If you decide to go to Murano they will have a water taxi pick you up and the taxi is paid for by the glass factory, be aware, that there will be a hard sell at the end. We went and then left though an hard to find exit and toured around the island where the other shops were a lot cheaper. This hotel was a really good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Be Better”
Reviews.Author: Sausca
Reviews.Content: I am late in writing this review, but we stayed for a week at the Ovidius at the beginning of November and it was just right. Small, quiet, un-pretentious, good value. We had Room 202 which is the size of a basketball court and has two shuttered windows overlooking the canal. The marble bath would have suited a Ritz. The best part was the personal caring attention of Flavia and Gianni at the desk (we had a health issue). I guess there are other small quiet out of the way hotels in Venice, but the ability to hang out the window and watch the canal and the Rialto Bridge was special.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Ovidius”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my 3 kids to Venice for Christmas, and we stayed at the Hotel Locanda Ovidius. I am so glad we did. The hotel was beautiful, quiet, located just off 5 min. from San Marco Square and 30 sec. from Rialto Bridge, yet away from the hustle bustle, in the middle of the island. The staff, especially Giovanna was wonderful. He took such good care of us, was so helpful. We truly enjoyed our stay at the Locanda Ovidius, and I hope to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Hurry Back!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in Venice. We spent 5 nights at the Hotel Ovidius in Jan. The most accomodating staff ever to be found. Great breakfast, deliciuos cappuccino and the perfect location. Rooms are comfortable and well appointed and most charming. We especially enjoyed the rooms with a view. Highly recommended. A rare find in Venezia!

HotelInfo.Name: Locanda Ovidius
HotelInfo.Address: Calle del Sturion 677/A | Rialto, San Paolo, 30125 Venice, Italy
